article.headline: Chattanooga 73, Kennesaw State 69
article.story: KENNESAW, Ga. -- DeAntre Jefferson had 16 points and 10 rebounds for his second career double-double to lead Chattanooga to a 73-69 win over Kennesaw State on Wednesday night. The Mocs (1-2) won their first game of the season while the Owls (2-1), fresh off an upset 80-63 win over Georgia Tech, could not maintain their momentum. After jumping out to an 8-0 advantage and leading 32-28 at halftime, Kennesaw State took only 18 shots from the field in the second half, making 10. Chattanooga tied the game at 45 on a Josh Odem 3-pointer with 12:53 to go. The game was tied seven more times, the last occasion at 69 with 1:41 to go on a 3-pointer by the Owls' Spencer Dixon. Jefferson scored on a layup 17 seconds later, then Odem, who had 14 points off the bench, hit two free throws with 5 seconds left. Markeith Cummings led Kennesaw State with 26 points and hit 14 of 16 free throws.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
